intro: Serapias azorica, commonly known as the Azorean orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Azores. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in the humid and temperate climate of the Azores. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a single, erect flowering stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
